page.title: 12COASTLINE-SEAVIEW SOUTHWARDS
page.content: { Seaview}has a short{esplanade}with many seats facing the English Channel. At the north end is{Seaview Yacht Club at the south end, a public slipway. The upper shore is a platform of eroded{Bembridge Limestone.}From Seaview southwards the coast forms two {sandy bays.}From the esplanade is a short footpath that ends abruptly. Because of difficulty of access{ {Seagrove Bay}is mainly used by local residents. In this bay, behind an area of broken sea wall, are wooden pillars and cables - the remains of{Seaview} {Suspension Pier}destroyed by storm in 1951. Nearby is the{Old Boathouse} dated 1557. Many houses along this bay have collapsed due to{subsidence} caused by{gault clay}known locally as Blue Slipper.{ Priory Bay}is bordered by woodland sheltering{The Priory,}an hotel on the site of a{Norman Abbey.}
